comments.commentBody:
Sing it, sister!

We are with you, Jacqueline.

Trump appears poised to provide the sort of leadership only a world weary manic depressive without material possessions, reasonable prospects, or even minimally congenial family relations could ever love. Donald Trump IS Bizarro Obama: working hard every day  to whip up yet another tempest in a teapot.  America badly needs an intervention.

Given the the overwhelming majority of Islamist attacks in the U.S. since 9/11 have been by people who are born here, the idea that banning Muslims would stop anything is rooting mainly in Islamophobia and hysteria; calling them as such is political correctness, it's simply correctness.

No Concerned, that's not what the voters wanted. Everyone knows that almost 3,000,000 more people voted for HRC than voted for Trump. The majority of Americans want to continue the policies that Obama furthered and do not want America to become the hate-filled, spiteful, vengeance-seeking nightmare that Trump encourages.

And look, it has only been noted about a billion times that Obama signed the order to close Gitmo but House Republicans refused to fund the operation. So now you know, too.

AVI
A lot of people are not stupid enough to buy your argument when republicans can't keep the public safe from domestic gun violence even when it they massacre children. How many terrorist deaths in this country in the last 50 years and how many violent gun deaths? You only want to punish people you don't like and not do anything to protect the citizens of this nation.
Trump is only correct in that terrorism is bad but his fawning relationship with a brutal dictator - Putin -is the real problem - what hold does Russia have over him? Why doesn't he acknowledge Russia invasion of Ukraine?
Knowing what we do about the leadership in China, I think if those kids had to write an essay about the air quality, they would have praised it as the best on Earth.

You are correct in a previous comment that the US has also lagged in environmental protection and that our upcoming administration will be nothing to be proud of in that way. Instead of angrily defending our own countries, all citizens of this planet should stand together against the lot of them for failing us in this matter. You are in Chengbu and I'm in Baltimore, but air and weather don't honor national boundaries or care about competing interests. We share a planet and our children will suffer for our folly and pride.

The study refereed to was not based on Shanghai sample. You are right the system is directed at passing The Test with good scores. A version of that has stormed into the American class room where teachers are evaluated on test scores since Bush’s no one left behind to the complaints of educators. In China it is the students’ problem and their aspiring parents who aim for top higher education.

Ah, I'd assumed you were referring to Pisa.

For the education system in general, it's a lot of very good effort aimed in a completely pointless direction. Long story short, for Western countries, tests are predominately viewed as part of the means to an end. There's a time after tests when all this knowledge is useless if it can't be applied in practical situations.

From what I've seen of the Chinese system, the test is the end, with no thought given to what comes next.

Which is why you get such a dramatic difference in results once school is finished (personally I'm a high school dropout that's now managing very large government computer networks. When doing this, I deal with Chinese teams fairly regularly on some side stuff... The quality is not remotely the same. Although far better than India)

Feng is a Fool. What was the insulting demeaning rhyme “…if you can’t do you teach, if you can’t teach you administrate?” The warning were everywhere from the national level of the “red alert” issued by the Chinese Ministry of Environmental Protection (MEP) and local governmental agencies. Interesting that the social network has taken on the function of the PTA, for school principals are enormously powerful creatures in China with very little oversight save some higher up in the CCP whose interest maybe less that educational.
On the positive side China is the world leader in Turbo and Solar and perhaps also Nuclear power development and is moving in stricter regulations on reducing carbon dioxide emissions.
With Scott Pruitt the new E.P.A. Administrator in the U SA, Feng may be remembered as a very minor case.

ummm...what struck me was not so much the smog...but the fact that cheating China is so rampant kids must take test outside in the middle of the winter ! cultures are NOT all the same are they, but I guess  its pretty to think so....

Well you could try looking at cross cultural sources of information where the comparative details are described , if not too much trouble. Connectography: Mapping the Future of Global Civilization by Parag Khanna is an excellent source.

I suspect that was just because the school was closed.

It's getting pretty chilly there at the moment. High of six degrees.

If that seems strange logic, they really don't think things through:

1. Schools are closed. No getting around that.

2. Exams are scheduled. No getting around that.

Solution:
Have them outside. The schools are still closed and the exams still happen.

Never on this one, it's not a rebus puzzle. Instead it's what I like to call a phantom rebus—one in which the "rebus" entries don't appear in the grid, but must be imagined as being outside the borders of the grid.

Most actual rebus squares read both across and down, but there are rare one-way-only exceptions. The best, most challenging, and most enjoyable rebuses not only read both ways but each set of rebus letters is different.

Well, the terrorists get their wish.

It's hard for any person that isn't prone to sweeping generalizations to see how this isn't a victory for fear and terror. It would be nice if America were on the winning side of this battle, but having elected a president with no courage or moral center we will become further divided. Funny how white terrorists in our country - of which there are more and who have caused great damage - don't capture the imagination and inspire paranoia the same way.

There are certainly criminals and bad people in the US (and everywhere), but there are NOT "white terrorists". Murderers like Dylan Roof (who rightfully will face the death penalty for his acts) are mentally disturbed, lone nuts. They have no real ideology. Roof actually like black people and had black friends. There is no vast "white terrorist" organization. The KKK and neo-Nazi groups number only a few thousand. They have no money. Most are nuts living in their mom's basement.

In contrast, there are 1.5 BILLION Muslims, and estimates are that 1/3rd of them are strongly sympathetic to ISIS or believe in The New Caliphate. And they are backed by countless billions of dollars of oil wealth.

"Funny how white terrorists in our country - of which there are more and who have caused great damage - don't capture the imagination and inspire paranoia the same way."

Americans killing Americans is so common that it looks OK to our Government and to us Americans.

Wait, what? Concerned Citizen is actually stating that 1) 1/3 of all Muslims on this planet are terrorists or would-be terrorists, 2) there is no such thing as a white terrorist and 3) people who are mentally ill deserve the death penalty? Unreal.

Ho-hum. Another attack on Trump, portraying him as a warmonger when he seeks peace with nuclear-armed Russia, and is interested in fair trade with China, not the current one-sided policies that have led to our devastating trade deficit.

I have to grin when I see you present as an august academic expert (as opposed to Trump, who you paint as an ignoramus)— some “credentialed" wonk who worked for George W. Bush. What could be more damning that to have been working for that president whose needless aggression against Iraq resulted in many times more dead and wounded than in Aleppo and destabilized the entire Middle East.

Trump is indeed the anti-establishment President-elect. We know that because of the bias and vitriol directed against him by the Establishment press.
Trump doesn't need anyone to "paint" him as an ignoramus, he is one .
When history is written about this moment in time one of the themes will be how Trump was able to fool so many gullible people into thinking he was anti-establishment.
Not every Trump critic is painting him as a warmonger...but if his policies, actions and/or random tweets cause or lead us all to end up dead, will it really matter what he was originally painted as?

I propose that our future ex-president elect use the emoji system for communicating, since there are no chances of misspelling any words, although there are plenty of times many chances of misinterpreting the meaning of these symbols. But from all the conflicting signals we are currently getting from our elected future ex president, It might not matter much in the final analysis
Thank you, Gregory, for the "future ex-president" tag.  Thinking of him that way may just save my sanity.

and Elke
Thank you, Prof. MacLachlan.
You singlehandedly disproved the axiom that Chemistry professors are stuffy.

I did not see the trick until ALIMONY and the ALDENS . Then the -OHASHIRTS and the rest made sense. The right side was easier than the left.
Despite the PURITANICAL and MIDI answers , quite a sensuAL puzzle : there is Sophia LOREN, REVEAL , PREMARITAL and CASUAL sex, ALLURE , Sally's (YES)x15 , P.O.D. Do you teach organic chemistry ?
Minor nit and not SNIPing - isn't the British form of Al ALUMINIUM ? (NB- ahem , B.C. )
Best answer : ALBERT EINSTEIN MEDAL.
Looking forward to more such clever puzzles.
May I suggest ab amendment that he "joins George Barany and Amitai to reconfirm that Chemistry professors are not stuffy?"
I've been experiencing similar oddities, Alex. The app's just buggy, I think.

Jason Miller: "Nothing is more important than keeping our people safe."

But then Trump wants to pal around with Putin. Go figure.

I'm very concerned that Trump is going to spill American intelligence to Putin. I think Trump's ego has been fed even more, since becoming privy to US intelligence secrets he never should have…especially as a corrupt businessman.

G
You are correct he has massacred hundreds of people, invaded an neighboring country, shot down a plane and stole billions from the Russia people while destroying Russia's attempt at democracy and freedom of self determination of how to govern and live as free people.
Long live the KGB and their thugs and down with freedom.
Why do so many trump lovers want to be serfs to the Putin? He would as soon kill you then let you criticize him.
Who are "our people" ?

Let's think that Donald Trump's incoherent foreign policy makes it coherent.
Interesting and scary times are in front of all of us.
Why are you scared of Russia?  Are they planning to invade?

All the more reason for a calm and well thought out strategy for America. The most powerful and effective thing an incoming President can do is to be quiet, listen, read - learn. Perhaps he could trade his childish tweeting for briefings. The boy in a man suit should grow up.

A
Only a fool would not be wary of a murderous thug and Putin is way worse than that. Ask the people who wanted a free Russia what they think about Putin - Oh wait they are shot dead or in a Siberian death camp.

A fair trade deal with China? You mean a trade war? Because guess what, China can actually very easily hurt us and destroy US jobs. What happens to all the workers at big box stores when all the merchandise dries up? What happens when the US faces trade tariffs on formerly cheap goods? The Chinese Communist Party is a hell of a lot smarter than Trump, and they're not going to respect his tough but ultimately hollow talk. If you honestly believe that this is going to end well for the US, you have another thing coming. Just like every other duped Trump supporter who live in a weird fantasy world where products just appear on shelves .
May your assessment be accurate. My concern is that it is not.
That myth  tells more about ancient Greeks than it does about womankind.

This comment caught my eye: "Sounds as though the NC voters have cut off their collective nose to spite their face."

As a North Carolina voter, it feels instead like my nose has been cut off without my consent. The GOP legislators behind HB2, and failure to repeal, hail from voting districts so gerrymandered that they were recently ruled unconstitutional for intentionally diluting the power of minority voters with what the ruling called "surgical precision." In 2016, Republican state house candidates won a small majority of votes (52% to 47%). Yet, they control a veto-proof majority of house seats (62% to 38%). GOP gerrymandering has transformed a 5% difference in votes to a 24% difference in legislative representation.

Without years of insidious voter suppression measures targeted at minority groups and other constituencies likely to vote for Democrats, the NC vote would likely be closer to 50-50. This year, the NC GOP chair sent emails instructing local election boards, "Republicans can and should make party line changes to early voting," making clear that efforts masked as "voter fraud prevention" have all along been aimed at partisan voter suppression. And GOP cries of "voter fraud" after the 2016 gubernatorial election were deemed baseless - by Republican election board members, no less.

As a voter, confronted by an electoral system that NC Republicans are tilting so far from democracy, I just hope these power-hungry hypocrites eventually do cut off their own noses.

Why is this a reason for businesses to refuse their do business or artists to perform in North Carolina? Those same businesses and artists don't refuse to go to states that are actively trying to repeal women's rights. I can't understand the logic other than transgender rights now appear to be more important than women's rights.
Very true!

This article is not about other states but about North Carolina.  Perhaps one should speak with the 13 Republican female representatives and the six Republican female Senators in the North Carolina Legislature about the rights of American citizens who live in that state.

The .3 percent of Americans that consider themselves transgender are the cause celeb at the moment. Americans has a very short attention span so they move onto another group soon. As long as a sub-culture makes a lot of noise (usually grossly disproportionate to its size), proves to be politically useful to a left leaning politician who does not give a damn the subculture or its goals, and has a famous member - usually from Hollywood rather than the business world - and gets a few musicians to boycott any place that doesn't support the subculture they didn't know existed a week ago, then transgender rights will become "retro" and be little more than a joke in popular culture.

This folks is what happens when you put Republican reactionaries in charge. They have no principles, no morals, no courage. Their entire ideology and reason for going into public office seems to be to hurt "liberals". Who it hurts, whose rights get trampled is of literal concern as long as they get to stick it to a progressive.

What a pathetic life.

Correct-North Carolina fits the definition of a failed state in many ways. Blatant baptist religion has entered the state government-in fact is directing the course of the government. The bathroom bill was a smoke screen to hid the ugly realities of the bill-HB2. With much of the rural population under sway of religious ignorance, undereducated, poorly informed, NC will continue down the path toward their real religion-based goals-end of abortion, end of gay marriage-end of LGBT persons and if they could manage it, the eradication of civil rights of black persons.
If this sounds like an otherworld vision from another country in another continent in another era-it is what some parts of America really are like-and where others are headed under the Trump authoritarian system.
The state should be subjected to a continual barrage of shunning-by groups and individuals who do not want their presence to be seen as an endorsement. The message may get through with dire economic strategies-but the real issue is the hearts and souls of the voters who put these Republicans into their statehouse. The state seems to have let the long time presence of right wing ignorance come to the top. Time for persons in the state who do not want a theocracy to make some noise.

Dallas Woodhouse's statement is shameful and hateful hypocrisy. His evident glee in making it causes me to wonder whether this was all just political theater designed to try to pin HB2 on Democrats. If so, it will fail. The NC Republican Party owns this despicable legislation, and responsibility for all its effects.

LBGT have all essential civil rights, by statute or constitution, often a patchwork but real. The remaining measures sought are attempts to gain by legislation, acceptance, which is not a legislative function and in fact violates the rights of others.
This seems like a trivial issue where the this community pines for acceptance which cannot de commanded by some law.

Sanctions never really work then when you are dealing with political entities with no care for the economic stability of their own state as well as the jobs of their citizens. Religion, the opium of the masses also causes their dying from an overdose. The Middle Ages are alive and well.

It's a beautiful state with many fine people.

But a state legislature that outlaws climate change is another good reason to stay out of NC!

I've had many wonder vacations in the Outer Banks. I'll never go there again.

With respect, the issue is not the transgender bathrooms.  If that were all at stake there would be little in any interest in the very, very small number of transgender people, who I suspect would go to the bathroom where they choose.  In fact, I would bet a lot of money that has been happening for years, and the world has turned as it ever has.

As a child growing up in Alabama more than 40 years ago I was taught to "live and let live." Those words have as much meaning today as they did then. The North Carolina legislature and governor willfully discriminate against LGBT people. That is not only cruel, but it has also significantly hurt the state economically. Neither will change until the law is repealed.

Alabama over 40 years ago? Isn't that when George Wallace stood in the door denying blacks an education saying, "segregation now and forever."  Southern discrimination was always just more overt than Northern racism.
